# PR and Issue Templates

This directory contains templates for Pull Requests and Issues to help maintain consistency and gather necessary information.

## üìã Pull Request Templates

When creating a PR, you can choose from these templates:

- **bug_fix.md** - For bug fixes
- **feature.md** - For new features
- **testing.md** - For test additions/improvements
- **general.md** - For refactoring, docs, config changes, etc.

**Note:** If you don't select a specific template, the default `pull_request_template.md` will be used.

### How to Use PR Templates:

1. When creating a PR on GitHub, the templates in `.github/pull_request_template/` will be available
2. You can also manually reference them by including the template content
3. Make sure to fill out all relevant sections, especially:
   - Device and browser information (for UI-related changes)
   - Screenshots or screen recordings (when applicable)
   - Testing instructions

## üêõ Issue Templates

When creating an issue, you'll be prompted to choose from:

- **Bug Report** - Report a bug
- **Feature Request** - Suggest a new feature
- **General Issue** - Questions, discussions, or other topics

### Required Information:

All templates ask for:

- **Device Information** - Device type, OS, OS version
- **Browser Information** - Browser name and version (if applicable)
- **Screen Resolution** - For UI-related issues
- **Screenshots/Screen Recordings** - To help visualize the issue or feature

## üì∏ Media Guidelines

When attaching screenshots or screen recordings:

- **Screenshots:** Use clear, annotated screenshots when possible
- **Screen Recordings:** Keep recordings concise and focused on the issue/feature
- **File Formats:** PNG, JPG for images; GIF, MP4 for videos
- **Size:** Compress large files when possible

## ü§ù Contributing

When submitting PRs or issues, please:

1. Choose the appropriate template
2. Fill out all relevant sections
3. Provide device/browser information for UI changes
4. Include screenshots/screen recordings when applicable
5. Be as detailed as possible in your descriptions

Thank you for contributing! üôè
